title: Build error on OS X: error: Unrecognized option: 'Q'.
body:
Git revison: `12b2607572d6233a1d4b4f7592573e49b505771e`
OS: OS X 10.9.2

Running `make VERBOSE=1` i got the following:

```
cfg: build triple x86_64-apple-darwin
cfg: host triples x86_64-apple-darwin
cfg: target triples x86_64-apple-darwin i686-apple-darwin
cfg: non-build target triples i686-apple-darwin
cfg: enabling more debugging (CFG_ENABLE_DEBUG)
cfg: host for x86_64-apple-darwin is x86_64
cfg: host for i686-apple-darwin is i386
cfg: os for x86_64-apple-darwin is apple-darwin
cfg: os for i686-apple-darwin is apple-darwin

cfg: no pandoc found, omitting PDF and EPUB docs
cfg: no llnextgen found, omitting grammar-verification

MATCHES=""; if [ -n "$MATCHES" ] ; then echo "warning: removing previous" \'libterm-*.rlib\' "libraries:" $MATCHES; rm $MATCHES ; fi

make: *** [x86_64-apple-darwin/stage2/lib/rustlib/i686-apple-darwin/lib/stamp.std] Error 101
```

`cmr` in IRC already hinted that wrong quoting is going on and that it should be `-C linker="clang++ -Qunused-arguments"`.
